intro: Symphyandra repens, commonly known as the trailing symphyandra, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Symphyandra repens thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in the understory of forests.
